profile_data.summary:
Ilona Murynets is a security engineer (Tech Lead) at Meta’s Internal Detection and Response team. She has technical expertise in machine learning and data science in application to anomaly, insider threat and fraud detection and has 10+ years of research and development experience in design and architecture of information security systems. As a security architect at a well-known financial software company, Ilona led research, design and prototyping of advanced security techniques for insider threat and fraud detection. She developed several alerting systems that continuously over-perform existing solutions from highly respected vendors. As a security research scientist at a major telecommunication company, Ilona invented and patented a novel method for mobile spam detection that drastically reduced the volume of spam messages received by customers. The fraud department had constantly praised her advances in mobile fraud detection. Ilona is passionate about her job, broadens her frontiers in anomaly and fraud detection and is constantly inspired by new challenges in cybersecurity. 
As a hobby, she enjoys winning coins at ethical hacking CTFs.
profile_data.headline: Security Engineer at Meta (Internal Detection & Response)

experience.description:
Member of the team that owns and drives the security technology roadmap for the entire companyTechnology leadership to improve security  of company’s systems and networksMachine learning and data science in application to anomaly and fraud detection Research, design and prototyping of advanced security techniques for intrusion and fraud detection. 

Company-wide consulting resource and a subject-matter expert supporting other departments such as physical security operations, legal and compliance, HR, CISO and product oversight

Provide data analysis insights for critical decisions to the upper management

Mentor engineers working on machine learning projects and teach an anomaly detection class.Developed several alerting systems that continuously over-perform existing solutions from highly respected vendorsDeveloped statistical models for anomaly detection in computer networks and prototyped a system alerting the security operations center
Developed machine learning algorithm detecting fraudulent account usage
experience.title: Tech Architect (CTO office)

experience.description:
Developed big data machine learning algorithms for fraud and abuse detection: SMS spam, SIM card hijacking, mobile malware, phishing, M2M anomalies, brute force attacks
Invented and prototyped a system automatically resolving customer security related problemsPatented multiple mobile security inventions and co-authored papers presented in  top communications and security conferencesOrganized and hosted workshops and a summitMentored PhD students/ interns
experience.title: Principal Member of Technical Staff

experience.description: My research is in the area of big data, machine learning, optimization and statistical analysis in application to malware propagation, spam detection, mobile and network security.
